ls_-la.explanation: Lists all files (-a) in long format (-l)

ls_.explanation: Shows files and directories in the current location

ls_-l.explanation: Lists files in long format with permissions, size, and date

ls_-lh.explanation: Lists files with sizes in KB, MB, GB format

ls_-R.explanation: Lists files in current directory and all subdirectories

cd_~.explanation: Changes to the user's home directory

pwd_.explanation: Prints the current working directory path

mkdir_directory_name.explanation: Makes a new directory with the specified name

rm_-r,directory.explanation: Recursively removes directories and their contents

cp_source,destination.explanation: Copies a file from source to destination

cp_-r,source_dir,destination_dir.explanation: Recursively copies directories and their contents

mv_source,destination.explanation: Moves files or directories to a new location or renames them

touch_filename.explanation: Creates a new empty file or updates timestamp of existing file

cat_filename.explanation: Displays the entire contents of a file

less_filename.explanation: Views file with pagination and scrolling

head_filename.explanation: Displays the first 10 lines of a file

head_-n,20,filename.explanation: Displays a specific number of lines from the beginning

tail_filename.explanation: Displays the last 10 lines of a file

tail_-f,filename.explanation: Shows the end of a file and continues to display updates as they occur

grep_pattern,filename.explanation: Finds lines containing the specified pattern in a file

grep_-r,pattern,directory.explanation: Searches for pattern in all files within directories and subdirectories

grep_-v,pattern,filename.explanation: Displays lines that don't contain the specified pattern

find_directory,-name,pattern.explanation: Searches for files matching the specified name pattern

find_directory,-size,+10M.explanation: Searches for files exceeding 10 megabytes in size

find_directory,-mtime,-7.explanation: Searches for files modified in the last 7 days

ps_aux.explanation: Displays all running processes with user and system info

ps_-ef.explanation: Shows all processes in full format with parent/child relationships

top_.explanation: Displays dynamic real-time view of running processes

htop_.explanation: Displays an interactive process viewer with more features than top

kill_PID.explanation: Sends termination signal to a process by its process ID

kill_-9,PID.explanation: Forcefully terminates a process that won't respond to normal kill

killall_process_name.explanation: Terminates all processes with the specified name

df_-h.explanation: Displays disk space usage in human-readable format

du_-sh,directory.explanation: Shows the total size of a directory in human-readable format

du_-h,--max-depth=1.explanation: Shows the size of immediate subdirectories in human-readable format

free_-h.explanation: Displays system memory usage in human-readable format

uptime_.explanation: Displays how long the system has been running

whoami_.explanation: Displays the username of the current user

id_.explanation: Displays user ID, group ID, and groups for the current user

who_.explanation: Lists users currently logged into the system

w_.explanation: Shows logged-in users and their current processes

date_.explanation: Displays the current system date and time

cal_.explanation: Displays a calendar for the current month

which_command.explanation: Displays the location of an executable in PATH

whereis_command.explanation: Shows the locations of binary, source, and man pages

man_command.explanation: Displays the manual page for a command

info_command.explanation: Displays comprehensive documentation for a command

whatis_command.explanation: Displays a one-line description of a command

alias_name='command'.explanation: Creates a shorthand alias for a command

chmod_+x,file.explanation: Adds execute permission to a file

chown_user:group,file.explanation: Changes the owner and group of a file

tar_-xzf,archive.tar.gz.explanation: Extracts files from a compressed tar archive

zip_-r,archive.zip,directory.explanation: Creates a zip archive of a directory

unzip_archive.zip.explanation: Extracts files from a zip archive

ssh_user@hostname.explanation: Establishes a secure shell connection to a remote host

scp_file,user@hostname:path.explanation: Securely copies files to a remote host

rsync_-avz,source,destination.explanation: Synchronizes files with advanced options and compression

curl_url.explanation: Makes HTTP requests and displays responses

ping_hostname.explanation: Tests network connection to a host

ip_addr.explanation: Displays IP addresses assigned to interfaces

netstat_-tuln.explanation: Shows active network connections and listening ports

ss_-tuln.explanation: Displays socket statistics, similar to netstat but faster

traceroute_hostname.explanation: Shows the network path to a destination

nslookup_domain.explanation: Queries DNS servers for domain information

dig_domain.explanation: Advanced DNS lookup tool with comprehensive output

uname_-a.explanation: Displays detailed system and kernel information

lsusb_.explanation: Lists all USB devices connected to the system

lspci_.explanation: Lists all PCI devices connected to the system

journalctl_.explanation: Displays logs from the systemd journal

systemctl_status,service.explanation: Shows the status of a systemd service

systemctl_enable,service.explanation: Configures a service to start automatically at boot

crontab_-l.explanation: Lists scheduled cron jobs for the current user

crontab_-e.explanation: Opens the cron job editor for the current user

at_time.explanation: Schedules a command to be executed once at a specified time

jobs_.explanation: Lists jobs running in the background in the current shell

bg_.explanation: Resumes a suspended job in the background

fg_.explanation: Brings a background job to the foreground

nohup_command &.explanation: Runs a command that continues after logging out

screen_.explanation: Creates a virtual terminal that can be detached and reattached

tmux_.explanation: Launches a terminal multiplexer with windows and panes

sort_file.explanation: Sorts the lines of a text file

sort_-n,file.explanation: Sorts lines numerically rather than alphabetically

wc_file.explanation: Counts lines, words, and characters in a file

wc_-l,file.explanation: Counts only the number of lines in a file

cut_-d,delimiter,-f,fields,file.explanation: Extracts specific fields (columns) from each line

comm_file1,file2.explanation: Compares two sorted files line by line

sed_'s/pattern/replacement/g',file.explanation: Stream editor for filtering and transforming text

xargs_command.explanation: Builds and executes command lines from standard input

tee_file.explanation: Reads from standard input and writes to both file and standard output

ln_-s,target,link_name.explanation: Creates a symbolic link to a file or directory

chroot_directory,command.explanation: Changes the apparent root directory for a command

sudo_command.explanation: Executes a command with administrative privileges

usermod_-aG,group,user.explanation: Adds a user to a supplementary group

gzip_file.explanation: Compresses a file using gzip compression

bzip2_file.explanation: Compresses a file using bzip2 compression (better ratio than gzip)

lsof_.explanation: Lists all open files and the processes that opened them

watch_command.explanation: Executes a command periodically and displays the output

time_command.explanation: Measures how long a command takes to execute

nice_command.explanation: Runs a command with modified scheduling priority

mount_device,directory.explanation: Mounts a filesystem to a directory

basename_path.explanation: Strips directory and suffix from filenames

dirname_path.explanation: Strips the last component from a file path

printenv_VARIABLE.explanation: Displays the value of a specific environment variable

export_VARIABLE=value.explanation: Sets an environment variable for the current shell and its children

seq_start,end.explanation: Prints a sequence of numbers from start to end

yes_string.explanation: Outputs a string repeatedly until interrupted

more_file.explanation: Views file content one screen at a time (older version of less)

fold_-w,width,file.explanation: Wraps each line in a file to fit a specified width

split_-l,lines,file,prefix.explanation: Splits a file into smaller files with specified number of lines

od_-x,file.explanation: Displays file content in various formats including hexadecimal

ufw_status.explanation: Shows the status of the Uncomplicated Firewall

fallocate_-l,size,file.explanation: Creates a file of a specified size instantly

chage_-l,user.explanation: Displays password aging information for a user

nmap_host.explanation: Network exploration and security auditing tool

nc_-l,port.explanation: Creates a simple TCP/IP listener on a specified port

nft_list,tables.explanation: Lists nftables firewall tables (newer alternative to iptables)

strace_command.explanation: Traces system calls and signals of a program

ltrace_command.explanation: Traces library calls of a program

iostat_.explanation: Reports CPU and input/output statistics for devices and partitions

sar_.explanation: Collects and reports system activity information

ulimit_-a.explanation: Displays user limits for system resources

fuser_file.explanation: Identifies processes using files or sockets

pgrep_pattern.explanation: Looks up processes based on name and other attributes

pkill_pattern.explanation: Sends signals to processes based on name and other attributes

pmap_PID.explanation: Reports memory map of a process

last_.explanation: Shows listing of last logged in users

lastlog_.explanation: Reports the most recent login of all users

getent_database,key.explanation: Gets entries from Name Service Switch libraries

hostnamectl_.explanation: Controls the system hostname and related settings

timedatectl_.explanation: Controls the system time and date

localectl_.explanation: Controls the system locale and keyboard layout settings

update-alternatives_--list,command.explanation: Maintains symbolic links determining default commands

apropos_keyword.explanation: Searches the manual page names and descriptions

apt_list,--installed.explanation: Lists all installed packages via APT package manager

apt-get_install,package.explanation: Installs a package using APT package manager

apt_update.explanation: Updates the package lists for upgrades and new package installations

yum_install,package.explanation: Installs a package using YUM package manager

dnf_list,installed.explanation: Lists all installed packages via DNF package manager

pacman_-S,package.explanation: Installs a package using Pacman package manager

zypper_search,--installed-only.explanation: Lists all installed packages on SUSE-based distributions

cfdisk_device.explanation: Displays or manipulates a disk partition table with user interface

mkfs_-t,type,device.explanation: Builds a Linux filesystem on a device

fsck_device.explanation: Checks and repairs a Linux filesystem

badblocks_device.explanation: Searches a device for bad blocks

lsblk_.explanation: Lists information about all available block devices

taskset_-c,cores,command.explanation: Sets or retrieves a process's CPU affinity

chrt_-f,priority,command.explanation: Manipulates the real-time attributes of a process
